$\text{Use mathematical induction to prove that }\forall n\in\N$
$P(n):1\cdot 2\cdot 3 + 2\cdot 3\cdot 4 + ... + n(n+1)(n+2) = n(n+1)(n+2)(n+3)/4$

    $\text{Before starting mathematical induction, we will simplify the equation above}$
    $P(n) = \sum_{i = 1}^n n(n+1)(n+2)$
    
    
    Base step (base case):
        $\text{We need to show that the formula is true when }n = 1$
        $\text{We will denote the two sides of the equation with LS (for left side)}$
        $\text{and RS (for right side)}$
        $LS = \sum_{i = 1}^n n(n+1)(n+2)$
            
            $= 1(1 + 1)(1 + 2)= 1(2)(3) = 6 $
        
        
        
        $RS = 1(2)(3)(4)/4 = 6 * \frac{4}{4} = 6 * 1 = 6$
        
        $\text{Thus the formula is true for n = 1}$
    
    
    
    
    Induction hypothesis
        $\text{We now assume that for n = k, }$
        $\sum_{i = 1}^k k(k+1)(k+2)= k(k+1)(k+2)(k+3)/4 $
        
        
        
        
    Induction step:
        $\text{We now need to show that this formula is also true for n = k + 1}$
        $\text{Hence we need to show that: }$
        
        $\sum_{i = 1}^{k + 1} k(k+1)(k+2)= (k + 1)(k + 1 + 1)(k + 1 + 2)(k + 1 + 3)/4$
       
        $\text{We will simplify the right side for sake of simplicity before continuing}$
        $\sum_{i = 1}^{k + 1} k(k+1)(k+2)= (k + 1)(k + 2)(k + 3)(k + 4)\cdot\frac{1}{4}$
        
        $\text{Now we will show this by simplifying the left side:}$
        
        $\sum_{i = 1}^{k + 1} k(k+1)(k+2)=\sum_{i = 1}^{k} k(k+1)(k+2) + (k + 1)(k + 1 + 1)(k + 1 + 2)$ <- By definition
                             
                             
                             $= k(k + 1)(k + 2)(k + 3)\cdot\frac{1}{4} + (k + 1)(k + 1 + 1)(k + 1 + 2)$ <- Induction hypothesis
                             
                             
                             $= k(k + 1)(k + 2)(k + 3)\cdot \frac{1}{4} + (k + 1)(k + 2)(k + 3)$ 
                             
                             $= (k + 1)(k + 2)(k + 3)\cdot (\frac{k}{4} + 1)$ 
                             
                             $= (k + 1)(k + 2)(k + 3)\cdot (\frac{k + 4}{4}$ 
                             
                             $= (k + 1)(k + 2)(k + 3)(k+4)\ \frac{1}{4}$ 
            $\text{And that ends the proof}$
